alert.note: Alert for Marshall (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 12:13PM EDT until April 01 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Harrison County in east central Ohio... Southwestern Jefferson County in east central Ohio... Northwestern Columbiana County in east central Ohio... Guernsey County in east central Ohio... Coshocton County in east central Ohio... Carroll County in east central Ohio... Belmont County in east central Ohio... Tuscarawas County in east central Ohio... Marshall County in northern West Virginia... * Until 100 PM EDT. * At 1212 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Creston to near Dresden, moving east at 90 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Coshocton, Cambridge, Uhrichsville, St. Clairsville, Barnesville, Cadiz, Carrollton, Freeport, Newcomerstown, and Minerva. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 172 and 219. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 37 and 95. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
